paper.title: Sequential random sampling

author.org: Mathematisches Seminar, Universität Kiel, Olshausenstrasse 40-60, D 2300 Kiel, Federal Republic of Germany
Institut für Statistik, Universität Graz, Lessingstrasse 27, A 8010 Graz, Austria

paper.abstract: Fast algorithms for selecting a random set of exactly k records from a file of n records are constructed. Selection is sequential: the sample records are chosen in the same order in which they occur in the file. All procedures run in O(k) time. The “geometric” method has two versions: with or without O(k) auxiliary space. A further procedure uses hashing techniques and requires O(k) space.
